text: What if your AI could actually read the room, crush creative writing benchmarks, and go to toe-to-toe with Google's Gemini 3 model? In late November 2025, XAI rolled out Grock 41 beta, a big upgrade to its chatbot that now runs on gro.com, X iOS, and Android. It scored top spots on emotional intelligence tests and even briefly touched number one on LM Arena text leaderboard. Today we're breaking down what's actually changed, what's just hype, and how you as a developer can use Gro 4.1's API. We have videos coming out all the time. Be sure to subscribe. Now, XAI didn't flip this on overnight. No. In fact, the first two weeks of November, they rent a silent rollout where some users unknowingly got the 4.1 beta while some stayed on the old models. They ran these AB tests on this and found that users preferred Gro 4.1 over 65% of the time over the previous version. On November 17th, XAI officially flipped the switch to roll out Gro 4.1 to all consumer apps. 2 days later, on November 19th, they rolled out Grock 4.1 fast and the agent tools API, a developer oriented model with a huge 2 million token context window aimed at tool calling and long context workflows. So, what's actually new in this 4.1 beta? Well, according to the XAI's release of Grock 4.1, we have some new things to expect. It's tuned for higher emotional intelligence, which leads the EQ bench emotional intelligence benchmark with a score around 1586 in thinking mode ahead of several rival models. Then we have much lower hallucinations. One analysis reports hallucination rates dropping from about 12% to just over 4%. That's a 65% reduction compared to just rock 4. And then we have big gains in creative writing with top tier scores on the creative writing v3 benchmark. XAI and Tech Press both frame moving 4.1 from its edgy, chaotic chatbot feel into a more emotionally evolved AI chatbot that's more emotionally aware, stable, and useful in real world workflows. Multiple sources claimed that Gro's 4.1 on thinking mode hit an ELO score of 1483 on the Ella Marina Tech leaderboard at least briefly holding the number one overall position with the non-thinking model holding really close behind. Articles also note that Grock 4.1 also holds close to near top on EQbench for emotional intelligent and ranks among the strongest models on creative writing benchmarks. But that doesn't mean it simply just beats everything. No. A recent Tom's Guide headto-head found Google's Gemini 3.0 winning overall in their nineprompt test, even though Grock 4.1 did better on some tasks like factual accuracy and creative writing. So, the headline isn't Grock killed Gemini. No, all this really means is that Grock 4.1 is now a frontier model that's trading blows with OpenAI, Anthropic, and Gemini, all depending on the task. Now, if you want to try this out, Grock 4.1 beta is already rolled out, so you can head on over to Gro or even X to try this out.
